snippet.title: NFL players talk about race with Harvard students
snippet.description: Richard Sherman was called all kinds of names after his raging rant at the end of the NFC championship game. It was worth it, the Seattle cornerback said, because it gave him a chance to talk about the perception of black athletes to a wider audience.

snippet.title: Russian social media CEO quits, flees country
snippet.description: The founder of Russia's leading social media network - a wunderkind often described as Russia's Mark Zuckerberg - has left his post as CEO and fled the country as cronies of President Vladimir Putin have made steady inroads into the company's ownership.

snippet.title: You asked and we answered your NSA coverage questions
snippet.description: The Behind the Headlines NSA conversation continues with more audience questions answered

snippet.title: Losing my religion: Clergy who no longer believe gather online
snippet.description: Catherine Dunphy came to seminary in her mid-20s, full of passion to work in the service of the Catholic Church. By the time she left, for many reasons, she had lost her faith.

snippet.title: Prince George's County volunteer opportunities
snippet.description: Volunteers are needed for cleanup events and to coach Little League baseball.

snippet.title: How, after 60 years, Brown v. Board of Education succeeded -- and didn't
snippet.description: The Brown decision wiped out the "separate but equal" rule, but did its accomplish its main goal?

snippet.title: Erdogan's comments on Armenian killings leave many unsatisfied
snippet.description: The language and timing of Turkish Prime Minister Erdogan's comments on Armenian killings leave many unsatisfied.

snippet.title: Alexandria-Arlington community events, April 24 to May 1, 2014
snippet.description: Book sales, pancake breakfast, Move Me Festival, Earth day celebration, Green Living Expo and more.

snippet.title: Mets ace Matt Harvey off Twitter after photo flap
snippet.description: The picture Matt Harvey tweeted of himself making an obscene gesture on his way into surgery caused such a stir that the injured New York Mets ace shut down his Twitter account.

snippet.title: In Washington, Muslims gather to get 'Happy' for the camera
snippet.description: Inspired by the hit Pharrell Williams song, about 50 dance to dispel a narrative of Islamist radicalism.
